name: Melia Granada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Fine for a couple of nights if you get it at a good price but by no means luxurious. Clean and reasonably comfortable but in need of a little TLC.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: Only a short walk to Cathedral and plenty of bars/ restaurants nearby
reviews.title: Slow reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: It is an average hotel although I am dissatisfied with the service. It took me more than 30 min to check in as the staff were very slow to take care of each registration. This pissed me off and made my experience in Granada bad. Other than that the room was clean although a bit old.
reviews.title: Average hotel with excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to the main road. Price wise, I found it comparatively reasonable compared to other 4star hotels in the area. The room itself was neat and clean; however, the ventilation in our room was quite poor. Im not even sure if the air con was working. The hotel staff also do not speak English too well, which made it difficult to orientate ourselves at first, but there was a Granada tourism office close by which had all the information we needed. Since I was just looking for a neat and clean place to stay, in a great location (most importantly) this fit the bill.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish I could go back to this fabulous city !!!
reviews.title: Excellent location, not a bad hotel, but not always Melia standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: Smallish rooms so book superior one with large terrace with sunbeds on 6th floor. We booked online 1 month in advance and got rate of 85 euro.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If driving, follow Calle Recogidas straight to hotel - ignore restriction signs as hotel will take your license plate number and pass to police! Car park next to hotel is 20 euro per day.
reviews.title: Good location, normal hotel, very helpful reception staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't eat in hotel except breakfast which was adequate but room gets crowded. Plenty of restaurants and tapasbars nearby especially in Calle Navas.
reviews.title: Great hotel, ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Taxi to Alhambra was 5 euros.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was short but we would have no complaints on the hotel itself in the main. We had a triple room which was small but the beds were comfortable and we slept well here. Bathroom was large and with a good powerful shower. Staff at reception were very helpful with all our queries and questions. Our only complaint would be that breakfast is vastly overpriced here so it's a better bet to go to the lovely cafe cross the road, much better value and nicer atmosphere. The only other issue was that the wifi is only available in reception not in th rooms.... Bit strange these day.... Bu small compliant.
reviews.title: Not a 4 Star Hotel When It Comes to Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled from Herradura, where we stayed in a Melia hotel, so continued the theme in Granada. This is a very nice central hotel, but the rooms are a bit on the small side - as is often the case in city centres. The breakfast buffet, although good and plentiful, was an absolute scrumdown - the staff couldn't keep up, although they made valiant attempts to do so, and were working very hard. The second day breakfast was a lot calmer - must have just been a busy day. The prices in the bar were eye-wateringly high, but as you are surrounded by restaurants and bars, there is no need to pay such high prices.
reviews.title: Another good Melia hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: One point is there is no hotel car park, and the public car park next door costs €20 a day !!
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Good Location in Granada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Granada Melia for one night in a superior room. The hotel was easy to find and has public parking right next door. Is in a good area of Granada, nice shopping nearby and a bank of tapas bars & restaurants just at the back. The room was a really good size with a lovely balcony. The bathroom was very clean and well equipped and we had robes and slippers. Most impressive was the bed which was super king size and SO comfy!! The hotel were very helpful when we emailed them about a trip to the Alhambra, we needed to visit on a certain day and couldn't get tickets on-line. The arranged trip wasn't cheap but was very worthwhile and well organised. Loved staying here and loved Granada, will be back!
reviews.title: Nice hotel and nice location, not very efficient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again a place we got to by our tour operator, and it was certainly nice and way way better than the Hotel Los Angeles that the 3* people on our tour got dumped into. Not quite as good as the Melia in Seville, but good rooms, a great fixed dinner for the tour people, good breakfast. But the service was a bit second rate and they weren't ready for us as was the Melia in Seville.
reviews.title: A great hotel on the better side of town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights and I couldn't have asked for a better hotel. It's in an area where it's not too crowded but close enough to the action.
reviews.title: Melia, a great choice also in Granada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was very nice. The room wasnt very big, and the furniture and carpet werent new but had a big TV. The staff was very very nice. They explained us what to do and where to eat and they were extremely polite.
reviews.title: good one, best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good too, with all sorts of things.
reviews.title: Melia Granada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: The location is perfect, in the very center, next to the bus stop that goes to La Alhambra (3-min walk) and just behind you have Calle Navas, full of Bar de Tapas. Also the Cathedral and Capilla Real is extremely close, and Calle Recogidas, full of shops.
reviews.title: No WIFI in the room. Otherwise nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a very good hotel in a very good location.
reviews.title: not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Melia Granada
reviews.title: Good location - average hotel

description: The Melia Granada is located in the heart of the city of Granada, near the cathedral, Calle Navas, Alcaiceria, the Puerta Real, Calle Elvira, Plaza Nueva, Realejo, Paseo de los Tristes, the Science Park and the Congress Centre.Its strategic location in the city centre, personalised service and excellent facilities make it the perfect choice for your visit to Granada.Neat the hotel, you can visit exclusive boutiques and fashion houses. Plus nearby there is a one of the city’s main leisure and entertainment areas with numerous tapas bars and restaurants. Meliá Granada is also just a short distance from the most trendy nightspots and major shopping streets such as Reyes Católicos, Recogidas or Mesones.
